Model

class amber.model.Model(parameters: Dict[str, Any])[source]

Bases: BaseModel

Base class for all simulation models, using DataFrames for data storage.

add_agent(agent)[source]

Add a new agent to the model.

Parameters:

agent – Agent instance to add

batch_record_agents(agent_data: list)[source]

Batch record agent data for better performance.

Parameters:

agent_data – List of dictionaries containing agent data

batch_update_agents(agent_ids: list, data: dict)[source]

Batch update multiple agents at once for better performance.

Parameters:

  • agent_ids – List of agent IDs to update

  • data – Dictionary of column names and values (or lists of values)

end()[source]

Finalize the simulation. Override this method in subclasses.

get_agent_data(agent_id: int) → DataFrame[source]

Get data for a specific agent.

Parameters:

agent_id – ID of the agent

Returns:

DataFrame containing agent’s data

get_agents_by_condition(condition: Expr) → DataFrame[source]

Get data for agents matching a condition.

Parameters:

condition – Polars expression to filter agents

Returns:

DataFrame containing matching agents’ data

record_model(name: str, value: Any)[source]

Record a model-level variable for the current time step.

Parameters:

  • name – Name of the variable

  • value – Value to record

run(steps: int | None = None) → Dict[str, DataFrame][source]

Run the simulation with progress reporting.

Parameters:

steps – Number of steps to run. If None, uses self.p[‘steps’]

Returns:

Dictionary containing simulation results

setup()[source]

Initialize the model. Override this method in subclasses.

step()[source]

Execute one time step. Override this method in subclasses.

update()[source]

Update model state after each step. Override this method in subclasses.

update_agent_data(agent_id: int, data: Dict[str, Any])[source]

Update data for a specific agent.

Parameters:

  • agent_id – ID of the agent

  • data – Dictionary of column names and values to update

The Model class is the foundation of any AMBER simulation. It provides the framework for:

  • Managing simulation time and execution

  • Storing and updating agent data

  • Recording model-level metrics

  • Coordinating agent behaviors

Basic Usage

import amber as am

class MyModel(am.Model):
    def setup(self):
        # Initialize agents and environment
        pass

    def step(self):
        # Define what happens each time step
        pass

# Run the model
model = MyModel({'steps': 100, 'seed': 42})
results = model.run()

Key Methods

Lifecycle Methods:

  • setup() - Called once at the beginning to initialize the model

  • step() - Called each time step to update agent states

  • update() - Called after step() to update model state

  • end() - Called once at the end of the simulation

Data Management:

  • add_agent(agent) - Add a new agent to the model

  • update_agent_data(agent_id, data) - Update data for a specific agent

  • get_agent_data(agent_id) - Retrieve data for a specific agent

  • record_model(name, value) - Record a model-level metric

Execution:

  • run() - Execute the full simulation and return results

  • run_step() - Execute a single time step
